name: Sakar Hills Camping
description:
It's a great camping spot, especially for motorbike travelers! And near the Greece and Turkish border.
It's clean, solid and cheap. It's 10 Euros for 2 persons and 2 bikes with one tent.
The British owner Mat is a great and lovely character who helps you out with everything. And he is pretty funny and has a lot of great stories to tell!
You can do washing and there are benches under a Bungalow where you can sit and relax.

10km away is a town where you can buy everything you need and 800m away is a little store in which you can buy food.

name: Eco Camping Batak
description: Located on Lake Batak in the mountains. A beautiful area. The campground has flat terraces for camping pitches, clean bathrooms and hot showers. Very nice place. You can also rent kayaks and bikes for a reasonable price. Electricity and wi-if included in price. 30 lev for a camper and 2 people. Gets very busy on the weekends during the summer. Try to avoid!

name: Buzludzha
description: Buzludzha - an abandoned building from the Bulgarian communist regime. There are a lot of nice spots next to the building where you can park and stay for the night.

name: Medina tires
description: Good tire shop. we got 4x4 tires for the price of Internet shops in Nl

name: Dragizhevo
description: Camping Veliko Tarnovo, owned by very friendly English couple. Clean showers and toilets. Large swimming pool with sun beds. Nice views. Close to historic town Veliko Tarnovo. You are really a guest here.

name: Topola
description: Camping Saint George, directly located on the Black Sea. Informal sites, very simple toilets & showers, beach with sun loungers (2 beds + umbrella 15 euro). 15 euro water & electricity included. Water with high amount of sulpher. Facilities not very clean. Loud music from the neighbouring resort.

name: Camping Vrana
description: Sadly the glory days of this place were probably in soviet era... gravel lot with big trees next to small river. Some really old cabins some of which seem to be lived in permanently. But staff nice and opened one of the cabins for bathroom / shower. Old old old but I think they make an effort to keep kinda cleanish... Also grounds not very flat if you are in a tent but lot fine if you have big rig and dont need any services. About 10min from center. Lots of shops nearby but unless you really really want to camp, probably apt in center would have been better option if interested in seeing the town. 10€

name: Camping Gradina
description: Basic camping in pine forest next to the beach. Pretty gross pit bathrooms with doors that dont lock. But next to beach and kitespot so pleasant enough if you dont need anything. There are two other campgrounds adjacent but both were much more crowded and the one to the south had very loud music playing at the bar until sunrise

name: Motocamp
description: 24 lev per night per person for bed and included breakfast. Right now, no tents due to some regulation changes. Great place, can do work on motorcycles and they can get oil and tires and arrange other things you might need. Highly recommended.

name: Stara Elena B&B
description: 25 lev per night per person. Breakfast included. Fast wifi and hot water. Very close to a medium Bulgaria/Turkey border. Secure parking. Owners are English and super helpful.

name: Milnik Monastery
description: Close to the monastery of Milnik is a free green area with a beautiful view to the mountains. In the night it's very quiet! A great place with a lot of energy.

name: Montana Lake
description: Dirt roads going down to the lake where you can stay! At night it's very quiet!

name: Belogradchik Fortress
description: An incredible fortress builded in impressive mountains! Worth to see...

name: Kamping Kromidovo
description: Fantastic place to camp. John and Sara are lovely hosts. Facilities are modern. Great showers, kitchen, laundry etc. Rooms are also available from 15€ per night.

name: Thermal Bath
description:
Natural hot spring, outside; lot of parking possibilities.
Overnight stays around the natural pools possible (and very common by Bulgarians).

name: Alexandrovo Camping
description: The place to be when coming from or going to Turkey. Lovely owners/nice family. Everything you are looking for on a campsite, including a beautiful view.

name: Buzludzha wild camp
description: Wild camp just down from the main site. Fire pits, flat ground. It's next to a road, but barely any traffic.

name: next to road 2702 I  the forest/ farmers land.
description: a place to crash for the night. not very beautiful but for one night it is okay.

name: Plovdiv. Skerzzo hotel.
description: nice hotel with right in front of the hotel free parking space. every room is different. lady of the reception was very helpful. rooms with shower or bath 25 euro s. the city of plovdiv is really lovely. some old roman buildings and a really relaxing vibe. nice for a few days luxury when you lived in nature for a while....

name: camping melnik
description: Just 2 km further than wine city Melnik you can find this simple campsite. Flat grass next to the river nice view on sandy hills. Drop toilet and warm shower also in the toilet but it works. Nice  owner but speaks no English.  We paid 10 lev for  2 person and car. It was a bit noisy because of the dog he barked during the night.

name: Pancake hill
description: 150m from the road we camped here at this great spot. You see a kind of farmhouse and in the corner you leave the gravel.The gravel.road is awesome and starts or ends in Pirin  and appr 35 km a farmer came by and said it's OK. the road is not suitable for big rigs <3500 kg. we started in Melnik and finish in Gotche Delchev.

name: free camp close to bachkovo monastery
description: as you have to pay for the parking in bachkovo (1 night 5€) we decided to look for sthg. else. found this nearby. road is not in sight and noise is minor. you are surrounded by trees. space is reachable over a bridge (not sure if fit for heavy riggs - there is another way in without bridge with hanging branches though). there is a river ca. 15m below the space.

name: cheap diesel stations
description: along the road cheap diesel stations with credit card use possible.

name: Lake Camp near Blagojewgrad
description: On the way to Rila monastery and the 7 lakes we took a rest here. It is a small lake (not ment for swimming) which provides possibilities to do sport. The parking is quiet in nighttime, during the evening there are locals jogging and having leisure time. Two restaurants close by and drinking water. There is an area for having barbecue. Good base for a start to some hiking tours as Blagojewgrad gives opportunity to get maps and infos. There might be possibilities to put a rent at a meadow on the back of the parking (behind the sport gear area - following a path through the wood). Didn't see any people with pets.

name: Free camp near Rila monastery
description: found this nice little spot near rila monastery. there is tables and benches, you can grill here. situated between several small and big rivers, lots of drinking water. there is a guy selling very good fish nearby at a cheap price.

name: nice spot next to river
description: a gravel track leads off the main road. drive about 100m on the gravel track and you will find a widening where a small and short track (to the left) leads to a flat and open space below to allow pitching of a tent  and a spot of fishing if you have a line.

name: Beautiful camp spot at lake
description: This spot is not too far from the main east-west freeway. Easy access by paved road. beautiful quiet lake. some locals here fishing and one car with camper trailer plus us in our car. plenty of space but not all level.

name: Beachish camp
description:
Car park behind Beach restaurants 
Flat and level
Good for discreet vans
Showers etc nearby

name: N & S Motor Service Shop
description:
Moto mechanic. Knowledgeable guy speaks English name of Stanislavs. 
00 359 87 8248770

Behind the 1st garage on left on the way into Yambol.

name: Camping next to the cliff
description: nice location at the cliff, next to the city

name: Good place right on the beach
description: The other option we found here was not as good as we thought so we have come to this another option, less people and more space to camp.

name: mall's parking
description: it could be an option before or after crossing the bridge to romania. big parking for a big mall where you can find all the shops you want... lot of people during the day  but very quiet by night. wifi and WC inside

name: Quarry
description:
This place is quiet, nice, right at the water with a good view at the surrounding mountains. Stayed two nights. 
the turnoff from the main road is at 42.181947, 24.132512

name: Dragoman Marshlands
description:
Small parking spot for the marshlands. Next to a rarely used road, so pretty quiet. Good for staying a night before or after the border. The road has many pot holes though.
An elevated wooden path leads into the marshlands towards the yellow observation tower and further in. You can see birds, ducks, frogs, snakes, underwater snails and so on.
About 200m to the east, a steep and barely visible path leads to a cave in the hills - nice view from up there.

name: Yaz. Bakardere
description: Wild Camp Site right next to a small lake. Met locals who spent a few days fishing here (10 lew per rod, someone apparently comes to the lake in the morning and collects the money). No paved surfaces around the lake and quiet muddy after rainfall to keep in mind. Nice, quiet place with a lot of nature (frog noises!)

name: Transit overnight stay
description: A small place at the end of a 200m gravel road next to the main road. In the night very quiet. Good for transit overnight camping. There is also a small river.

name: Sunrise Beach
description: Wild camping with some places to park car and beautiful sandy beach. Old campfires dotted around. Road can get sandy away from trees. Heading East, when close to beach take the second road to the left. Google says that Bulgarian Technofest is held here each year

name: kosmos campsite
description: big camping ground near the coast.there is a restaurant nearby

name: Shiroka polyana Lake campsite
description: Beautiful (and popular among Bulgarian campers) alpine lake in the Rhodopian mountains.

name: Camping Delphin
description: You can find great spots on the forest side of the camping. Hot water and Ok toilets, but a bit far from the forest side.

name: Coastal wildcamping spot close to Schabla
description: We took the small road from Schabla to the coast to look for a spot and found this beautiful one. There were a few fishermen and some people camping (tents and a campervan). It is accessible by a dirt road.

name: Irakli Beach Wild Camping
description:
Ccamping spot that seems to be popular among locals. Many people with tents down on the beach and even more spread out up in the bushes with cars and even some camper vans. There is also an official campground nearby, this one however is accessible through a dirt road and is located South from the official one. Some rubbish bins are around and there is a small shop at the beach selling some necessities (open 8-20).
When we were there (end of June) there was almost no space anymore.. It's a beautiful spot and there are many nice people around. We got water from the public bathrooms that are in the back of the restaurant next to the official camping, but you probably can't access it by car without paying the parking fee and it's around 30mins to walk from the camping spot.

name: On the cliffs of Cape Agalina
description: The southbound small coastal road leads in a loop over Cape Agalina. A small dirt road (can be very muddy after rain) leads through the bush to a small opening where a few cars could park. We walked down the small path and camped right on the cliffs, a beautiful spot! There is access to the sea as well.

name: Grassy area in the woods among rock pillars
description:
This is the entrance to the forest track leading for about 2 km to a small open grassy area surrounded by forest and rock pillars. 
Track not drivable for anything much bigger than a VW van. There is an intersection along the track, turn right. A spring is a few steps down a path from the open camping space. No 4x4 needed.

name: Melnik
description: Parking at the 'entrance' to the village; not overly romantic but very convenient when visiting the village; quiet a night

name: Rila Monastery
description:
limited Parking right in front of the monastery entrance, might be busy and difficult to find a slot during day time but late arrival should provide for a spot. Charge €5 valid till 10am next day, so you can visit the monastery late evening and early morning and avoid the crowds.
quiet at night

name: along road no 84
description:
difficult to find a spot between Banska and Velingrad … we eventually picked this roadside bay. The road is very quiet at night, although a couple of cars stopped and had a look what was staying here; but we were left in peace.
One can draw water from the source … as at many other places in this country

name: nice spot with view on the lake
description: drive into this small forest road from #37 for a couple of hundred yds and enjoy the view on the lake. There might be one or the other fisherman or hunter passing by, but for the rest it is very quiet.

name: Parking at the river
description: Parking on the north side of the river, just opposite and in walking distance of the town center. Sign and barrier (out of order) indicate a parking fee, but police and taxi driver said 'no fee' … and we stayed for two nights, no problem … but also not very quiet (loud music at night)

name: Guesthouse Master Nikola Gogov
description: Nice renovated traditional houses, good for spending a night before going to Turkey. Quiet and safe location, in the middle of nowhere (a national park). Prices vary, we found one that was 12.5EUR per person.

name: Riverside at Svilengrad
description: Small city next to Greek and Turkish border, you can stay just next to the river, there are several options following smal dirt road. Greek cellphone reception.

name: Place under rocks
description: nice plane near the road under the rocks:)

name: Plovdiv
description: Small personal hotel in center of the old town. Parking space in front of hotel. Center only accesible behind a bar.

name: Torch Monument
description:
Below the Buzludzha Monument on a wide open parking/meadow in front of the Torch Monument and viewing up to Buzludzha (nice at sunset).
Very quiet
Be aware: one can still drive up the Buzludzha and possibly also stay the night there, but since spring 2018, the building is closed and guarded 7/24

name: huge parking at Nessebar
description:
We were surprised to find this huge and not expensive (L12/24hrs) parking at this place. No problem to get in and stay for the night. Can be busy during daytime due to coming and going cars and coaches, but dead at night … and at the far end, you might well be on your own at all.
Could all be different in the high season ...

name: Sosopol Stadium
description:
The most central parking at the marina is expensive and small and packed with buses. The friendly warden sent us to the parking just behind the stadium, which is a short walk to the beach.
Very friendly warden there too, no problem to stay for the night (€9 for a big rig), even water was available ... but it is definitely not more than a parking lot ...
However, we were told the parking is always full during the high season

name: great beach place at Sinemorets
description:
Great beach with some nice restaurants … and lots of space to park and very quiet nights … but one is obviously somewhat exposed … but nobody really cares
water and toilets possibly at the beach restaurants

name: Wild campspot at shelter next to river
description:
Its next to the road but very little traffic at night. We stayed here with two motorbikes and a tent, but there would be space for more.  A police car came by in the evening but didn’t bother to stop when they saw our tent. 

There is a river nearby. The hut at the shelter has a fire place and a well next to it. There also is a place for a van or bigger rig.

name: Wildcamping at river under the tree
description: A beautiful wild camping spot, next the river under the tree (perfect shadow). You take road next the tunnel (old road that is not any more used I think).

name: Camping Verila
description: Cosy little campsite, grassy field, some trees give shadow. Facilities are ok. 15 euro for 2 people and campervan. 2 euro for using the washing machine. Restaurant at the campsite (we didn't try it). The site is well located for visiting the seven lakes of rila.

name: Camping Ribkata
description:
Little campsite in front of the owners house, next to a river. The owner doesn't recommend swimming, because it's not safe. He doesn't speak english but helps himself with google translate.
It is about half an hour to Sofia, you can also book a shuttle which costs 10€ one way.
One toilet, one shower and both seem to be very old. It's not dirty, but it smells. The toilet brush seems to had its best days in the 70s..
The field is grassy and trees give shadow, but 20 euro for 2 persons and campervan is a little bit high priced!

name: Silistar Beach Camping
description: Very nice place for one week nearby the beach. Entance to the campground is a little bit tricky because the trees. Not higher then 3.20m. Extremely clear ocean and sandy beach.

name: Madona Camping
description: Cosy little campsite in a grassy garden area in front of a hotel/restaurant. Some trees give shadow. A lot of animals walking around. Thats's maybe why dogs are not allowed according to the shield on the entrance. Facilities are very clean. Very quiet at night. Friendly owner. We paid 15 euro for 2 persons and campervan. (Google maps will lead you to leave the main road to the left to a dirt road, but the entrance is actually a little further down the main road. You will see the house and turn left after the end of the garden.)

name: Camping by the river
description:
A nice lawn between the road and the river that locals use for picnicking and wild camping. We arrived on the Sunday afternoon and there where five or six campers there, but in the evening they were all gone. 
We checked by them and they said that staying overnight is absolutely ok.

name: Water reservoir lake
description: Very pretty place, nice swimming water. Good camp ground with good views. Downside is that there is a lot of waste around.

name: Suhin Dol Hotel and Restaurant, Belimel
description:
Just nice, clean and cheap place to sleep...we paid 18€ for two, clean room, warm shower, secured parking for motorcycle.
Dinner at restaurant was very delicious and cost about 3€
Only ‘live’ place in Belimel, on main road

name: Eyes of God
description:
A small but high cave where you walk about 50 metres (2 min walk)and look up to the ceiling to find two large openings in the roof of the cave that are in the shape of eyes.
This is a very popular attraction.
Well worth the effort to travel here.

name: Wild camping above Rila Monastery
description:
Just above Kirilova Polyana, the old military road continues. We recommend to use 4x4 vehicle with enough clearance to get to the camp site. A regular vehicle can get there too, but much slower, and you have to be careful due to the rocks on the track.

There are lots of places to camp along the way - most of them have the needed tables and benches for a rest and a campfire. The firewood can be sources from the forest. We are not saying to chop down the trees - there are lots of fallen trees to pick up from.

The Manastriska Reka (Monastery River) runs along the track and the camp sites. Should you have a water pump it is not a problem to have one.

We have written blog in English here: https://4x4-camping.com/2018/09/къмпинг-на-тиха-рила/

name: Camping in an old quarry
description:
Nice spot in an old quarry/sandpit. Not far from road but you can hide behind tress and inside the quarry. 
4G Telenor Signal. 11/2021—Evidence of some recent sand removal—relatively small amount. Saw no one on Sunday.

name: Camping spot next to war memorial
description: Very nice, small parking area next to war memorial, high up at 1150m and on a very very quiet road. There are no services, but it's a beautiful location.

name: Parking next to monument and spring
description: Small pull off away from road. We stayed one night and it was very quiet. There is water across the road. Poor mobile signal on most networks.

name: Motorhead 4x4 garage
description: The owner is a great friend of mine, and an overlanding enthusiasts. All the parts for Land Rove,r and capability to order for other vehicles and install them. Road assistance too. All the help, info and even camping spot. +359897985668 Tom

name: Hwy 13
description: A nice roadside spring used by many locals. We filled up here.

name: Camping on old football field
description: We were desperate for somewhere to camp for the night and find this little spot on am old football field. Right up against the hedge it was ok with the locals for a night. Water available in the village.

name: Outside Bansko
description: This spot is just outside the center of Bansko. You drive out the building area onto a gravel road. When you are a little out of sight, you turn on one of the meadows.

name: Overnight transit next to the road
description: This is actually just a meadow next to the road. The traffic is very low. You are visible from the road so the few ones who pass will be looking at you like you are an animal in the zoo.

name: Nice spot next to the river
description: Turn steeply down from the main road next to a farmers land. Continue towards the river and find a way through the bushes. The spot is in sandy/rocky terrain right next to the river. In the evening we had dogs noticed us, but further everything was nice and quit.

name: close to Devetashka Cave
description: 200m away from the gravel parking lot of the cave. you can also camp on the parking lot but here it's more private. access from the last turn before the parking lot or off of the parking lot.

name: next to River
description: plenty of space next to the river. this is not the most beautiful spot but it's quite handy. we stayed here to do some washing because the river is quite clean and easy to access. quite a bit of trash and you can hear the road but you can camp behind the bushes so noone will see you.

name: Varna Campingstop
description:
Secured campsite with video surveillance and fence good to stay for visiting Sofia. Taxi downtown for 7 euro. Not a cosy place but secure. 
Water, electricity, shower available. If you want to enter in the evening you have to call the owner. He will open the gate. Speaks English, German. Nice guy. Takes care for taxi, etc.

name: Starite Borove
description:
*Seasonal Closures.
.....
Lovely campsite in a beautiful location. We paid 20 leva a night for a camper with 2 occupants. Owners couldn't have done more to make us feel welcome, despite our having arrived at what must have been the worst possible moment in all the year for them (they were setting up for a celebration of the local area the following morning, with locals arriving by the coachload). Food was delicious, facilities clean and well organised. Highly recommended, but do them a favour and only turn up between 3rd May and end of the school holidays in September.

name: Dirt track next to the lake
description: Stunning surroundings. Phone's camera really doesn't do it justice. Heard many wolves howling in the distance at night, but no bother from them, or the locals who drove past occasionally. The dirt track leading down to it is no worse than most tarmacked roads in Bulgaria.

name: Flamable water!!!
description: clean water source that the locals fill up from and drink straight out of the pipe. it seems to be coming up from under ground with natural gas. Put a match to the small holes round the back!

name: Botev Peak Base
description: At beginning of the trail to the Botev Peak you will find some space. there is a grassy patch between two houses, next to the river across the bungalow rental (it was fine with the owner to sleep there) or earlier on the road I saw plenty of firepits and spots to park and camp.

name: Vodopad waterfall
description: Beautiful place nearby a waterfall, on weekdays not many people are here, more frequent on weekend. sun all day long, pretty bad road conditions to reach but worth it. there is a big space with a fireplace and benches, if it is crouded you can hike a bit and find wondeful places where you could sleap with a tent. The water is fresh and clean.

name: Hidden at a lake
description: One of the most beautiful places we found by now in Bulgaria. directly on a lake, you can also camp between trees. Lokals go fishing here but it is not crowded. The path is not the best and a bit hidden but we drove here with a normal car and it was no problem. When you drive on the Main road there is a small exess to the field along the coastline of the lake.

name: Camping with wind protection
description: There have been some overlanders pretty close, but with a van or when there was no wind I guess. We found this little spot protected from the wind and relatively clean compared to the rest of the cliff. Also we cleaned up in the morning. Not sure how long that lasts. The spot is about 10 meters to the cliffs and a little path goes down to the sand beach. There is a small fire place and an amazing sunrise view! No problems with locals or authorities. A bit challenging for normal cars(no 4x4) to reach, allthough the locals do it with any type. Cozy place we will visit again ;)

name: View on wonderful rocks
description: If you come from Shumen the entrance is the third entrance after the second bridge(north). Accesable by camper and close to the water. Nice and clean after we were here so enjoy the view.

name: Quiet pine camping near the beach
description: We found this place by accident, because we took the wrong exit. After a hike to the actual spot on the map there were so many Caravans and people, so that we decided to stay here and enjoy the "lonliness" ;) Easy accessable by all types. We passed a well one village before the spot with free drinking water.

name: Small well
description: Drinkable fresh water next to the road to the beach.

name: Campsite next to the fields
description: We we're rejected at the turkish border because of a missing power of attorney because the car is registered to my Mum. So we drove to get some grocerys at a nearby mini market with very cute owners and found this little spot with a ready fireplace next to some fields. Easy accessable also for big rigs just a bit uneven. Very green and nothing special but better than the road.

description:
Land Rover workshop and parts, 4x4 tours Safaris & expeditions,
informal campsite, rooms,vehicle storage & rental ( only on our guided tours and expeditions)
info@wildrovers4x4.com

name: Wild camping near a river
description:
A nice place near the Vit river. A shade is provided by the large trees. There are lots of mosquito - be prepared.

The river has fish. Careful if you have small children - the river is very strong. Can be crossed with a 4WD vehicle.

name: Border zone - not allowed for vehicles
description:
While this route is well developed, it is going by the border zone between Bulgaria and Turkey. It has a 30kms of buffer zone and it is not allowed for motorized vehicles. 

For crossing by bicycle or on the foot, you must inform the authorities one month in advance!

name: Aheloi Dam - wild camping place
description: A silent place to camp near water. Fishing and swimming are forbidden! There are snakes in the area during summer - take precautions.

name: Wild camping near an ancient church and a monastery
description:
A very quite place to camp near a monastery. There are ruins of ancient church which is buried halfway in the ground.

There is a waterfall nearby which is accessible by foot.

name: Lokorsko wild camping grounds
description:
Camping grounds near a stream.

During the weekend, lots of locals visit them and prepare some BBQ.

Not recommended for large rigs - lots of low tree branches. There is a MTB track near by where Bulgarian Enduro series take place - it is a very popular track and there might be lots of mountain bikers in the area.

name: Wild camping near a river and a monastery
description: A quite place for camping accessible by rocky dirt road. The river is cold even during high summer, and it is also safe for kids to play around.

name: Wild camping near a dam
description: Accessible by dirt road. There is an ancient chalet to visit in the area, high above the rocky hills.

name: Camping ground near a tourist path
description:
There is a tourist path nearby (eco-path), which was rebuilt with EU funds.

Along the trail, there are camping grounds, nearby a river. Not allowed to go into the grounds themselves with a vehicle as it is a national park.

name: Camping grounds Golyam Beglik
description: Camping grounds near Golyam Beglik. Lots of camping spots and nice trails in the area - both 4WD and hiking / cycling.

name: Camping Ivan
description: Small camping facility with friendly owner. Next to metro station and Lidl. Very convenient fo visiting Sofia. 10€ + 2€ electric.

name: Torch Monument hillside
description: Great spot with amazing views. Grassy with fire rings. Drive over the hill from the monument parking and there are many spots hidden from road.

name: Wild camping near a river - Ryakata Neighbourhood
description:
Don't be fooled that that is supposed to be a remote neighbourhood! The access requires decent driving skills or a proper 4WD - lots of sharp stones (technically you are driving inside the river bed), passing a few times a river.

This place is in a private property, near a river. Ask the locals where to park your rig because sometimes they need to grow the grass for their cattle.

There are a couple of wooden tables and benches created by the locals.

In the morning, there is lots of morning dew because of the ravine and the river.

Other suitable activities in the area to explore are Karadjov's stone and a climbing area.

name: Ticket office
description: Here you can arrange a reservation for the ferry departing from Burgas to Batumi (Georgia). They speak English.

name: Ferry port entrance
description: Entrance gate for the ferry from Burgas to Batumi

name: Chauffeur Beach
description: Roadside grassy area above the beach. Room for 3 or 4 rigs and easy access down to the sandy beach. Occasional cars on the road during the day, but quiet at night.

name: hotel near Shipka Pass
description: Before Buzkudzha we look for a place for punt the tent but it was raining and we stay at this hotel.

name: close tot Batak
description: Nice place on a lake. 1029 m. above sealevel

name: Meadow alongside Byala Reka
description: One of several park ups alongside the river, these coordinates are fine for large vehicles, other spots closer to Kalofer aren't. There are a few springs that the locals drink from. This spot seems to be a popular park-up for mushroom picking. The road leading up here from Kalofer is fantastic by Bulgarian standards, unlike the ones leading to the Ecopark just above Kalofer (we gave up trying to get there after a couple of hours and we have pretty good ground clearance).

name: Access track to pylons with stunning views
description: Meadow with track just off reasonable tarmac road. The views towards the mountains are stunning (difficult to see from the pictures, given the cloud and rubbish photography). A few cars passed but nobody seemed to mind us being there. Saw a couple of hares in the meadow in the evening (huge, as with all Bulgarian wildlife).

name: Belmaken
description: Nice place by the lake. Parking close to the road. Not much traffic. Good location for walking in the mountains. Close to sport centrum with swimming pool and sauna.

name: Camp Kirilovo
description: Simple camping in a small village. When we came nobody was there and the number of a mobile phone we found on Google Maps was not working. We were able to pay for it in the morning when some Irish guy in Mini car came and went. We paid only 20 BGN for 2 persons, 2 motorbikes and one tent. You will find there hot shower, toilet and a small kitchen (quite messy, with spiders).

name: Propane Station
description:
LPG station EuroGas, where it's possible to fill gas bottle.
The owner has some connection adapters.
Price 0,95Leva/L

name: Bushcamp near river
description:
Wild camp near a little river, on the road to Koprivshtitsa. Near the road but quiet at night and you can heard the amazing howling of wolf and jackal.
Before the river there is a little spot (ok for a car or a van) and if you cross the river there are a lot of flat and grassy spots.

name: Quiet camping place near a stream
description: easy to access place with a stream nearby. lots of mites during the hot season, no 4x4 needed. Strong 4G/LTE signal.

name: Bozhenitza with a nice view
description: nice forest, near to a climbing route. the forest provides nice shelter. very nice view to the ravine

name: quiet picknick area on the way to blue mountains
description: Campground on a picknick area along the road to blue mountains. Apparently a well visited spot during daytime, but quiet in the evening. Nobody came to this spot, just a few cars passed this spot. There is a sitting area, a few swings, a place for campfires and a toilet as well.

name: Kulata Camp and Hotel
description: friendly staff, good cook, big parking 1lev/hour parking...

name: Free parking next to cave
description:
There is quite a lot of space, really quiet. 
No one bothered us. We were there in 3 cars, 11 people and there was no problem. We came when it was dark already and got up the next morning. So it's great for one night stay.

name: Wild camping with a view
description:
Accessible via a normal road and then a little gnarly 4x4 track. There is an alcove at the spot, and a meadow just at the end of the track.

While the view is picturesque, it is not kids or pets friendly due to the plumbing cliffs - you will need to watch after your loved ones.

name: Camping near a stream
description: A very flat meadow, easily accessible by a 4WD from the village of Dryanovo. There is a stream nearby. You can continue your journey to Narechenski Bani on 4WD track and some tarmac - you need a prepared 4x4 vehicle or an expedition / offroad motor cycle.

name: Camping spot with a view
description:
Meadow above village of Kosovo with a nice view. There is a stream like 2 kms away next to a horse stable.

The promised “meadow” is actually ‘a large picnic area with benches and many firepits spread over several clearings on the edge of the forest’. In summer it is unlikely you will be alone here. There is a good asphalt road starting in Maskovo leading most of the way up, only the last few hundred meter are good dirt road. 

There is a good spring with strong flow where the tarmac ends. Oh and the waypoint is of by a few hundred meters and leads you down a track where it is hard to turn around. Look for benches on your left for the right spot.

name: National gathering Gela camping grounds
description: This meadow is used during the national gathering of pipes in Bulgaria. There is a big stream nearby with three or four spouts.

name: Camping spot near Trigrad
description: Very convenient place next to a main track. There is a stream nearby

name: Between field and forest
description: Very nice place right beside a field, noone around, quiet at night. You are hidden from the road by a lot of trees. Possible for every vehicle. Not perfectly flat but ok. You could even go further the road and see if there is a better place. We stayed one night.

name: Offroad magical Rock Formations
description:
Super spot with rock formations almost 360° around. Grassy area with firepit and room for 2 maybe 3 cars. No shade. 4x4 recommended, but the road is not too difficult, you just can not be worried about scratches to the bodywork. Got there with my 2,3m high defender, you cannot be much higher. Good 4G reception. Easy walk to the spectacular castle 1,5 km.
Use Google (satellite) and start from the ioverlander place closest to the road.

name: Tomin Most Memorial
description:
The great memorial of Tomin Most, near Krivodol, composed as it is of various elements, covers an entire hill in the north-west of the country.
It commemorates 70 rioters who fell in September 1923 in a field battle with government forces.
A bas-relief is placed at the beginning of the stairway, now impassable, which allowed to reach the heart of the monumental area: it represents an insurgent who proudly raises his weapon to the sky. Other structures, often covered by tall grass, are home to bas-reliefs dedicated to scenes of struggle and inscriptions linked to those distant events: they surround the gigantic Mother Bulgaria that dominates the area from above.
On his body appear, stiff, regimented and almost faceless, stylized figures of rebels: fallen, in the rhetorical image proposed by the monument, for the freedom of the country and the affirmation of the communist ideal.

name: Hotel Zora
description:
Two star hotel with secure underground parking in walking distance into Vratsa.
Room was worn but clean enough. 40 lev for single occupancy for the night with breakfast which was ok.

name: Bell Valley Park
description: There are three parking areas surround this park, it’s a lovely little park bells from around the world for children to ring. It’s very clean on the grounds and there are picnic areas. Quiet enough road and not far off the motorway.

name: Lake Belmaken
description: Great views, very quiet and calm and clean. Approach this spot from the North is no problem. Track from the south (with many more nice spots) is narrow due to dense vegetation

name: Bachkovo monastery
description: Parking directly next to bachkovo monastery. We asked locals where to park for night after trying another place they told us to go directly to the monastery. Nobody cares there are trash bins and benches. Toilets are available for the fee.

name: Green Card Insurance for Europe
description:
To buy Green Card insurance for Europe you must exit the border and turn right at the first exit on the road to Kapitan Adreevo city (about 3km after the border).  

You will cross the village and you will reach the end of the street. There are several sales kiosks. We bought at Ofis OZK Sigorta.

The price was 73.50 euros for 1 month including other countries in Europe for a Land Rover Defender 110.

The police didn’t asked the Green Card in the border. Remember to buy the vinhete too!

name: Road of benches
description:
A few km south of Koprivtshtitsa. EU funded a tourist project and they put a whole lot of benches along a dirt track that can be driven. Track gets progressively worse, but manageable without 4x4. 
A few bodies of water along the track, but not sure if ok to swim. We were here on a Sunday and it was quiet and calm. Beautiful surroundings!

name: Le Retro hostel and bars
description: traditional buildings converted into the first Hostel in Bansko. room is cool (high altitude)& surroundung area is nicely decorated. free kitchen &Wi-Fi, parking our bike inside coz it is safer according to owner's advice.

name: Best Rest Guesthouse
description: Has an 8-bed room or 3-bed rooms with shared bathroom. Small kitchen but only sink, fridge & microwave. Washing machine available. Parking for a few cars & motorbikes by reservation. Good for 1 or 2 nights as no full kitchen. Very close to the old town.

name: Wild camping with a view
description: Wild camping nearby a cell phone antena with a nice view. There are some historical landmarks in the area such as Tracian walls and rock holes. Also, a chattel called the Ridge (Biloto) is near by.

name: On the cliffs
description: Beautiful quiet spot perched on top of the cliffs. Out of sight of anything nearby. We saw nobody. Only neighbours are mussels and at night some fishermen in their boats. Easy access but not a lot of room to get next to the track (and out of the field... or down the cliff). Easiest access via turnoff at 43°24′31.21″N 28°24′09.66″E. Both directions of the coastal track will get you there too. Big rigs might want to check out the parking lot under construction (not active) at 43°24′31.39″N 28°23′09.29″E

name: Krapets beach
description: Nice bit of beach. Wildcamping seems obligatory :-). approach from Krapets, drive past the official campsite. During high season there will be loads of caravans/tents/... here, but keep driving until the peninsula, barely any people there, we basically had the place to ourselves. There is a water source on the track down here (lhs) but we did not use it. A few impromptu beach bars and restaurants in the busy part

name: Field near Chapel
description: We crossed the Turkey/ Bulgarian border late afternoon and found this quiet spot in the middle of nowhere. The track is easy and doesn't require 4x4. The apex of the hill is reasonably flat.

name: Nechovo
description:
cul de sac point de départ pour aller les voir les roches troglodyte
Dead end good to Walk to cave rock

name: Ardino
description:
parking Downtown town other side River no service


parking a côté du centre de l'autre côté de la rivière bien quand il y a de l'orage

name: Zlatovrha Monastery
description:
picnic area front the monastery one Monk Saïd OK


sur l'aire de picnic du monastère avec l'accord de 50% des moines ils sont 2 😂

name: Smolyan
description:
en bas de la ville grande aire a côté jardin d'enfants et commerces tranquille
Eastpak entrance town between River and children garden near food shops

name: Beden
description: Amazing view from village for drinking water IS enough to come here --- la vue splendide depuis le village mérite le détour. pour faire le plein d'eau potable

name: Trigrad Gorge
description: no traffic, night parking with table for picnic --- un parking aménagé au bord de la route et rivière pas de trafic la nuit bon arrêt sous l'orage

name: Rupite or Roupite
description: drinking water on main place of village --- eau potable place du village

name: By the river
description:
4 km before the border, on a field near the river. Quiet.

A 4 km de la frontière dans un champ au bord de la rivière calme.

name: Snezhanka tower
description: Right under Snezhanka tower on top of the Pamporovo ski area. Asphalt road all the way up. Picnic area with a bench and many more spots following the track up in the woods. Very quiet nights, some mountainbikers wizzing past during day. Magnificent sunsets and impressive sight of the tower at night. You can have your morning coffee up in the tower if you like. Unless you have a vehicle on tracks, this is very much a summer only spot. Altitude just shy of 2000meter.

name: Brashlyan Village
description: grassy muddy ground,infront of a farm ,quiet place during night but when we woke up in the morning ,horses were standing around the car.there are some restaurant and shops in the village and there is a walking route to natural park.

name: Brashlyan village natural park
description: beautiful grassy ground located in natural park,a little bit far from the village,bumpy road ,you'd better go there by 4x4 but not really offroad

name: Malko Tarnovo ,Strandja Nature park
description: 2 km far from Malko Tarnovo,quiet place during night,there is potable spring water down the spot near the small monestary.the place has barbeque.

name: Vihren hut
description: Great base to start the ascend of mount Vihren or of the many other hikes. There is a little parking in front of the (large) hut, but we thought it be more polite to camp just before the parking next to the street. It is all a bit cramped here, but the location is worth it. The asphalt road leading here is closed between 8am and 4pm. It also narrow with limited options to turn around. Best to arrive in the evening. Other cars will come park around you as of 6am. There is a public toilet and fresh water source (slow). Alternatively there is a large parking with bar/resto where the road becomes limited. Many people camping there too

name: THE LAST BULLET
description: a very nice place... water toilet, free camping bar behind very quiet place. Mr. Mikołaj (the owner) very good Man  the camp Field just behind the church...At the bar you can eat, drink and charge the phone but only payments cash sorry for my English

name: Big parking behind the shop
description:
In theory, this is a very big space for trucks. In fact there was a very big empty space. Was quiet. There are toilets (not free) and showers (3€!)
Don't buy your highway sticker here(see more information in comments!), you will pay 12€ instead 8€. Wait few kilometers next Gas station.

name: See Camp
description:
Beautiful Spot on a small lake. Not really remote, some fishermen during daylight.
Had an XXL Campfire and no one looks after me. Some noise near (barking dogs)

name: All Express - motorcycle and car tires
description:
Very well stocked and reasonably priced tires.  They stock Heidenau, Dunlop and many others.  Mainly motorcycle tires but they do have car tires and can order things in if needed.  

Can also do minor mechanic... oil change, breaks etc.  

Very helpful staff!  

A Heidenau K60 scout 130/80-70 cost me about 100 euros.

name: Grassy field next to river
description: Nice field along a small river. Used by a few locals during the day for fishing and swimming, but totally quiet at night. Reachable for every kind of car if you access from the path starting just before the bridge. The bridge makes some noise when cars cross it but it didn’t bothered us.

name: Cariana Hotel
description: Nice owner, speaks good English, helpful and price for two persons was 22€ in the middle of the old town.

name: Water source
description:
Water source with drinkable water on the climb. 

Trinkwasserquelle an der Passstraße.

name: Mishkova Niva near border
description: Perfect place for spending the night before or after border crossing. Plenty of space for any kind of vehicle. We drove down but bigger rigs can stay in the parking lot. Some friendly tourists came, watched Mishkova Niva and left. Completely quite at night. Lot of shade from trees. Still 3G with Turkish turkcell.

name: Beach
description: Nice place a bit above the ocean with good access to the beach (by walk). Accessible for any kind of vehicle. In main season it could be really busy. Two drinking water sources on the beach. Nice place to spend some nights. No shade.

name: Lakeside
description: Good place to spend a night or two at a lake (swimming forbidden). Plenty of space for any kind of vehicle around the lake. Access road is a bit bumpy. 2wd enough but drive slowly. A lot of shade from trees. 4G signal with A1. Completely quiet, we saw nobody. Just a few people on the other side of the lake. A bit of trash lying around.

name: Nomado Hostel
description: Moto parking! Nice double room(25Levs), shared (but really nice) bathroom, full kitchen, decent wifi, hangout area and porch, close to everything in Varna. bunk rooms too, can find on Booking.com

name: Vineyard view
description: Start of some gravel roads, leading to multiple spots with marvellous views over mountains, valleys and a vineyard. 4x4 recommended. can be windy.

name: Hilltop
description: Nice place but on the border arena. Border police showed up in the evening and in the morning.

name: Fields
description: Follow the double track from the road into the fields. You will camp at the close to the woods.

name: session style hotel
description: Nice place, secure moto parking (3 maybe), private rooms are great, shared toilets (2) and decent kitchen. The place is spotless and Dani is super nice. Can be booked on booking.com for €27 night/ 2 people.

name: Quiet alpine forest wild camp
description: Wild camp on a 2wd dirt track in Pirin Nation Park. Quiet, private and secluded from tourist spots and surrounded by tall pine trees. About 300 meters down the track is a flat spot for cars or tents. Stayed 2 nights in early October, only saw 2 walkers. Track leads down to 2 chairlifts with a beautiful view.

name: Forest camp near Rila 7 Lakes
description: Good spot for a night on the way to or from Rila 7 Lakes chairlift. Near bottom of the mountain, there is a dirt road (unmarked on maps.me and google maps) off the big hairpin turn of the main road. Flat spot 10 meters back or larger spots 500meters back. Beautiful forests, very quiet and private. 2wd accessible.

name: Mexaha restaurant
description: Very good restaurant and really nice welcome! Do not hesitate to have a break here after visiting the wonderful Kordopoulov house.

name: Shady grove near Prohodna cave
description: Nice grove of small trees up an informal 2wd animal track in the fields next to amazing Prohodna cave. Relatively flat spots for tents or big rigs, site is directly on top of smaller 2nd cave. Very quiet, sway from main cave area, no one in the area, nice sunset. Stayed 1 night. Fresh water near main road side - concrete trough with tap. Caves get lots of local visitors and rock climbers - no entrance fee.

name: Riverside wild camp
description: Grassy flat spot beside river near Lakatnik - good spot if you're rock climbing/hiking/rafting nearby. Down narrow dirt road (too narrow for wide rigs) and left under bridge. Road and train line are visible but noise is minimal. No houses nearby and no one bothered us, stayed 1 night. River water is not drinkable but there is a water tap nearby (driving) at the base of the hikes up the hill.

name: Dragoman, Touristinfo
description: Parking lot behind the Tourist Info beside the stadion Granichar; good open WiFi dragonet; local residents said it's no problem to stay for the night;

name: Varna
description: Parking next to a restaurant.   Nobody bothered us here.  Even the police drove past and did nothing.  Noisy at night.  Great location for the beach and only 2.7km into downtown.  There is a little train ferrying passengers into town in season.

name: A1 motorway between Burgas and Sofie.
description: We were allowed to fill up our tank with water here.  The fuel station is on the A1 motorway.

name: Lake side
description:
Moderator Note: The co-ordinates are correct. Please check the water level if you go to this place!!

Quiet spot.  A few fishermen here.  The road is difficult and uneven. Good ground clearance is advisable.  PLEASE NOTE:  Here are the coordinates for the turnoff from the 55.  N42.628796, E025.833150.  From here it is 1.8km to the lake.  I wouldn't recommend coming here when it's wet.

name: Camping Ukraine
description: At the moment this is a very basic campsite in the owners garden with just a drop toilet. It is very safe and quiet, and the own and his family are extremely helpful and friendly (they even invited us to join them for dinner). The man and his daughter speak good English. For a camper it is currently ~€5/night, less for a tent. They have plans to develop the site over the next year, so perhaps the cost will increase.

name: ATM
description: Random ATM located outside an apartment building, just outside the lobby. All cards accepted (Visa/MC/Amex)

name: Propane butane filling place
description: Filled up our bottle, have scale and lots of adaptors. Spoke English.

name: Diel Hostel
description: In the hub of town, have secure Moto parking or landcruiser would fit, owners speak English and are superb hosts, everything works well including WiFi and the place is very clean, they are rated 9.8 on Booking so that is excellent.

name: Hostel Mostel
description:
Very nice hostel. amazing breakfast 
60 Lev private room (some with en-suite)

March 2021- I paid €6 on booking.com
August 2022- €8 for dorms.

name: By the lake
description: Flat space by the lake, last 200m is a dirt road, but passable by 2WD. Nobody around and really quiet, village is about 1km away

name: Lidl
description: Convenient along the main Sofia - Bucharest road for stocking up without having to enter a major city, or just to buy snacks. There's a fast food (grill) joint in the parking lot as well.

name: Dea's Farm
description: We are an organic farm with a place for a campsite and motorhome parking.

name: Struma petrol station
description: Quiet overnight parking for campers, good Wi-Fi. Free parking.

name: Camping Velingrad
description:
5 star campsite resort. Don't skip this place if you're in Bulgaria. It's a 5 star facility with all modern amenities. It's like a spa resort for campers. Unlimited access to Finnish sauna, salt room, steam room, massive outdoor mineral hot tub, indoor and out door pools, relaxation room, there's a kid's room and outdoor play set. There's a huge dining room with cooking area and fridge with a vending machine with beer in it! Restaurants and bars across the street, grocery store a 5 minute bike ride. Christina the manager is a great host and will make sure you have everything you need.

We paid €35 for 2 adults and our van which includes water, electricity, WC dump and free access to washer and dryer as well! 

There is space for tents but I am unsure if they allow them, so would call to check.

Can't recommend enough, treat yourself for excellent value.

You can Google Camping Velingrad to find their website for more info.

name: Beach in a cove
description: Great spot to park/camp. You can drive out on to the concrete pier, or on to the beach. little stream meets the ocean. Not much fire wood around.  A few people around but pretty quiet.

name: Kresna
description: Plenty of water, at least in March. it's right next to the main road

name: Quiet spot next to the river
description: About 800 meters from the main road there are a few spots on the river that are good for a night or two. The unpaved road is good, no 4x4 needed. There are little beaches to get in the water. The only drawback - mosquitoes.

name: Camping Borovetz
description: A cosy little campsite on a ski resort that feels a bit like you're camping in someone's garden! A shower and washing facilities are available in the building in the middle of the grounds.

name: Motorsport BG / Margel
description:
Motorcycle repair shop - one of the best in town. Complex mechanic works, oil change, breaks etc. Motorcycle and car tires.

Address: 52 Simeonovsko Shose Blvd.

name: Durankulak
description:
A wild camping spot designated by the municipality. Very nice place, accessible also by most normal passenger cars. There is a lot of wood and lighting fire in the existing fire pits is permitted. The beach is long, but there is a lot of seagrass. Usually it is quite windy.
There is good mobile phone / 3g coverage.

name: Emona Beach
description:
Quiet rocky beach. Usually there are no people around and the sea is calm because it is well protected from north winds an waves.
Accessible by dirt road from the village of Emona. No 4wd needed in dry weather but the last 50m of the road may be a bit of a problem for vehicles higher than 2.20m.
It is not especially designated as a camping spot, but according to Bulgarian wall it is legal to camp here (as well as most of the country territory).
There is good mobile / 3g coverage.
Normally there is a lot of wood for fire.

name: At small cabin
description:
[ADMIN NOTE: check on arrival that this is not private property] 
Small cabin house with benches / tables and a fire place, bit dirty. But nice place for one van, good view.

name: Monastery parking in green
description:
Lovely very quiet parking place of the monastery, in the Green. 
Large vieuw over Country +hills.

name: Camping Laguna
description:
Camping and lovely sandy Black sea beach. You can park your Camper or Caravan or tent here. Use the running water and washing machines available as well.

the price for a landcruiser one person is 49 lewa.no service only for parking

name: Peralia Laundry (пераля)
description:
Laundry Service. One load washing & tumble drying 4BNG. There are more expensive options, but at the end, your laundry is done :-)
No need to do anything, the lady (no English) and her MIELE machines take care of everything.

name: Santa Sofia Guesthouse
description:
Right in the center: 50m away from the excavations where Sofia was founded. Pedestrian Zone 100m away, Metro 50m. 

Gated and guarded safe parking 50m away, 2BGN/hr, no height limitations. Motorbikes park in the yard.

Guesthouse is very clean and as most rooms are around the courtyard terrace, it’s VERY quiet.
Private bathroom, nice terrace, kitchen use, comfortable beds, fast internet, English speaking owner.
The reception is not 24/7, but they will be there at your announced arrival time.

No breakfast served, but there is a cafe that serves organic coffee and pastries next door. Or you prepare your own (little minimarket in metro station) and enjoy it on the guesthouse‘s terrace.
Highly recommended!

We spent 36BGN per night for 2 in a triple with private bathroom. On booking it’s 20€.

name: Danube view
description:
There are 2 restaurants here directly at the shore of Danube river. We‘ve already been twice to the right one with the green roof. It’s self-service and they have different kinds of fish dishes (riba) and traditional spicy meat „balls“ (pljeskavitza). Or try bean stew „bob“ and other typical dish. 
No tourist prices asked (prices per weight), real homemade food on a „terrace“ overlooking the danube.

name: Pomorie Salt mud
description:
Here you can rub some mud into your budy :) Locals like it. You should grab dirt from the lake. 

You should then stand in sun for 40 minutes to let it dry and then you wash yourself again in the salt water. 

Free, probably you can stay for the night. Not much people. Great.

name: Madara Horseman
description:
Bulgaria‘s National symbol you find on Stotinki Coins of the Leva currency. UNESCO world Heritage Site!
Steep climb, so come early in the morning (9:00) before the sun can grill you on the stairs :-)
There are nice caves and a cave chapel in the cliff, so plan an hour or so to explore. No shade at the horseman, but the rest feels like a tropical forest :-)

name: Camping, Kajakclub
description: Nice place in the forest near the river. About 200m from the street. Look for the sign on a rock beside the street. Friendly people there

name: Under a tree in a field next to a cemetery
description:
Grassy field with cliffs in background and open fields in front. Go up the track leading to the Roman settlement and cemetery. Up the stone road next to cemetery and round the corner. Nice pasture with lovely sunset...bit creepy though.. 
Lots of great walks and history in this area.

name: Varvara coast
description: Very nice camping spot with fireplace, nice view over the Sea, some shade. Several spots close to the road.

name: Side of the road
description: Beautiful sunset just off road. No rubbish, level ground.

name: Spot for a tent marvelous views
description:
On turn look for a clearly visible side road going up the hill. It’s pretty steep. Follow it until you get to the potato field. There you have camping spot with excellent views to the mountains!

We got there by bicycles. I think you can go there with a car. 
No water. We got some around 0,5km down the main road. 

Quiet spot, stars view, in the morning mountains are in light and in the evening sun over the mountains :)

name: Lisi Vrah Camping
description:
British-owned B&B and campsite. Motorbike-crazy owner, very peaceful setting.
Double room with breakfast is 30BGN 
Camping (with washing machine, little shop, bar etc).
The place is small, so better send them a WhatsApp to make sure they can accommodate you.
Lovely place in the middle of a typical Bulgarian village. 
We keep coming back here for years but just today got the idea of putting it on iOverlander. :-)

name: Close to the road but in nature
description:
Nice flat places with grass inbetween the trees. Suitable for all kinds of vehicles and tents. 
Close to the road but quiet at night. Good mobile coverage.
Visit the „stone wedding“ and the „stone mushrooms“ on your way north!

name: Dekanite Lake
description:
Nice and quiet spots around this lake.
the water is clean, but it's forbidden to swim and fish. 4G

name: Lonely gravel road near river
description: Beautiful place close to the Bulgarien Greece border. You drive down a steep short peace of gravel road (made it back up next day with front drive Fiat Ducato but probably not for big rigs) then there's a long gravel road along the river with a lot of nice spots. Nobody drove by the day we stayed there, there is a train line close by and opposite the river a gravel pit. Lots of mosquitoes.

name: Drinking water in front of the "travel Center rola"
description:
Drinking water in front of the 
"travel Center rola".
1/2" thread, medium pressure.
good quality.

name: Green Cheese of Cerni Vit.
description:
Private cheese production from sheep milk. About 1000 kg/a.
45 days old cheese 40 BLV/kg
Mrs. Tsonka speak a little English.

name: Neptune
description: Beautiful camping site next to the Beach. seaside. wide sandy area.

name: Near Emen Canyon.
description:
A property that has been abandoned for decades with a large, flat meadow at the highest point. 
It is advisable to wear high shoes because of the thistles.  
Totally calm, beautiful foresight.
Sometimes Internet.
Big rigs ok, but the road is limited 10 to.. ?

name: A1 Shop, but Saturday and Sunday closed!
description: A1 Shop for mobile internet and phone simcards. Saturday and Sunday closed!

name: Fishermen's place at the lake.
description:
It's quiet at night.
Lot of fishermen in the early morning and until sunset.
A lot of garbage- as everywhere here.
Sometimes 4G.

name: Gladiator Offroad Technik
description:
If there is anything you forgot before your big adventure heading east, you’ll find it here.
English and German spoken. 
Dream-shop for all 4x4 enthusiasts.

name: Sleep in a monk‘s cell!
description:
It’s possible to spend a night in the monastery.
15BGN (7,50€)/person. Simple bedding, shared bathroom.
Very cool experience!

name: Nice meadow
description:
A flat meadow suitable for tents and vehicles.
A good track (no 4x4 needed) leading there.
You can hear many jackals in the night. :-)

name: Meadow - 1218 m
description:
Perfect place to escape summer heat!
Meadow on top of the mountains at 1218m.
Cool, but not cold (in September). 
Flat enough to pitch a tent, big enough for huge trucks.
No mosquitoes, just quiet nature :-)
No shade but it’s high enough to welcome the sun instead of fleeing from it after sunrise :-)
Good 4G signal (A1) if you have to get things done.

name: Powerful fountain
description:
This fountain had a lot of water even in September when many others were already dry after the long hot summer. 
Good to fill up without waiting ages for the canisters to fill :-)

name: Guesthouse „Home“
description:
Central & clean with parking!
Motorbikes park in the yard, cars park for free (snd under shady trees) on the parking of a former cinema just next to the guesthouse.
Private rooms with shared OR private bathroom, with OR without balcony, starting from 13€/night.
Very clean, English spoken. 
No breakfast, but coffee automat next to the gate, dairy shop across the street and Bulgarian breakfast place (banitzsanitsa) 100m towards pedestrian area. 
All sights within walking distance. Very fast and reliable internet.

name: Free shady parking
description:
Parking in central Plovdiv is not free and you have to pay with SMS. 
This here is the parking of the former cinema, so off-street and therefore not in the blue zone.
It’s shady and in walking distance to all sights. I parked here 3 days without problems.
I would even consider spending the night here, BUT the road is one of the main roads and has heavy traffic.
You can’t access the parking from the main road, check your GPS routing before activating it, you have to drive through the small roads to get there.

name: Guesthouse Velkovski
description:
True Bulgarian hospitality!
A Bulgarian lady is renting out rooms in her house. Room rates start from 11€.
The house is located in front of a peach and grape yard in a very quiet residential area. It feels like staying in a village.
No English spoken but not needed. The lady will warm your heart from the first second. She is very welcoming makes you feel home but respects your privacy as she lives upstairs.
Safe motorbike (and normal car) parking in the gated yard. Higher cars park on the street (felt more than safe doing so). 
Internet is very fast and reliable. There is a garden kitchen you may use.
You can book through Booking.com, no need to call.

name: Jumbo Plaza Parking
description:
This big parking turns into an overnight spots for trucks, vans, RVs and other travelers.
Shops around are open until 21:00 (and music will stop then). 
There is a free toilet at Jumbo (updtairs, 9-21) and when buying a drink/meal at McDonald‘s you get a 24hrs pincode for the 24/24 toilet.
LIDL gets early (very early!) morning delivery, so stay on the parking and not near the green behind.
Shops open at 9, most overnight stayers disappear with sunrise.
Stayed there since 2012 many nights.  Safe but unspectacular.
There is WiFi at dm and McDonald‘s.

name: Laundry
description:
Laundry service. 
Washing and drying (no self-service) with Miele machines.
English spoken.
11 BGN for express service (3 -4 hours), 8 BGN overnight service.

name: Sandy beach and private island
description:
Sandy beach ideal for tents or those who want to proof themselves that there really is a daily need for expedition vehicles and 4x4 :-)
All others just enjoy this place with 2WD, motorbike or bicycle without expensive features :-)
There is a little island you can camp on (watercrossing only 10cm deep), but please don’t drive around in the riverbed as it’s full of fish. Ideal for fishing!
If you want to enjoy a decent dinner, we recommend Restaurant „Mosta“ at the roundabout next to the old beautiful bridge. Now that you know where to sleep it’s time to get to know the region!
PLEASE: this place is unspoiled, no rubbish laying around. So please keep it like that! We added a place to this App 7 weeks ago and when we came back last weekend, there was toilet paper all over the hidden place. So please be respectful and keep this beach as beautiful as it is today!

name: A1 mobile Internet
description:
A1 is one of the main mobile networks in Bulgaria.
At A1 shops you can get data only simcards for very competitive prices.
If you want to make phonecalls as well, prices are higher.
They have 4 weeks data only packages such as 15Gb for 7,50 € or 30Gb for 12,50€
If you run out of data, it’s much cheaper to buy a new simcard than to top up.
We‘ve been using it for 3 months now and are more than satisfied with the network coverage.

name: Sunny Paradise Campsite
description: Good access to roadways, about 300m from/to Motorway, with easy access to each pitch. 230V 16 Amp electricity hook-up installed to EU regulations w/safety switches. Fresh drinkable water supply to each pitch. Grass and hardstanding pitches. Wi-Fi, hot showers and washing machines. Pet friendly.

name: Car repair
description:
Clean workshop. 
Owner speaks German, mechanic some English.
They get the parts they need from Burgas, so if you come early, chances are high they finish the same day.
Fair prices.
There are TWO workshops, we recommend the first one coming from the stadium.
They also wash and rent cars.
Telephone number is the one if German speaking guy, they also have road assistance and a tow truck.

name: Fish restaurant
description:
This place is away from the crowds and only locals know :-)
Fish restaurant with excellent seafood. Menu only in Bulgarian, but the waiter speaks English and google translate does a very good job.
The grilled fish with fries and vegetables was 5,50€, the whole Kalamar stuffed with seafood-risotto was 6€. The garlic bread 0,60€ (fresh garlic & dill). 
No tourists around, very pleasant atmosphere!

name: PCR Test @ Ramus Lab (inside Dental Clinic)
description:
For all those who need a PCR Test / CORONA Test / COVID-19 Test before entering Greece, you can get it done here. 24h (max 48h) service. BGN 100 per person. Cash payment only. Don’t forget to bring ID card / passport.

https://goo.gl/maps/ScZRGJfDpA55Zqqc7

name: Механа стара къща
description:
Tavern „Old house. A little bit hidden, but a true gem of untouristy Bulgarian food and untouristy prices! The couple that runs the place speaks only Bulgarian, but the menu is available in English.
There is a mussels farm down at the sea, so that’s a good idea to order. A huge plate of fresh mussels is 4€ (8BGN). Other typical dishes like the Kavarma (meat and vegetables cooked slowly in a claypot) are one of the best we had in 3 months in Bulgaria.
Real traditional food away from tourist traps!

name: Mutafova Guesthouse
description:
This Guesthouse is more a Homestay than a hotel. Ask the lady for breakfast (extra cost) and you will learn a traditional bulgarian breakfast. It’s called „Mekitsi“ and you can find it in „banitsarnitsas“ outside of homestays as well. :-)
Very comfortable rooms with private bathroom in a traditional bulgarian house with beautiful garden. 
Motorbikes and bicycles park inside under the roof, cars outside on the (safe!) village road.
There is a kitchen if you want to prepare your own food.
Very peaceful place, host speaks English and some German.
We payed 22€ for the double room.

name: Chevren Medieval Village
description: Excellent place to park for the night. A nice little bar and restaurant place with toilets which stays open till 10.30. I asked if I could sleep there in my van and they said no problem and even left the toilets unlocked for me. Climbed up to medieval village in morning before it got too hot.

name: Blue rocks national park
description: Beautiful wide open spot at the end of the dead end road. A play garden, sort of flat spots, and so beautiful nature Forest. We were here in autumn and colours were amazing. You can make beautiful walks in this national park. Very old trees. There are lots of abandoned hotels. Seventies communism leftovers. Locals told us that they belonged to the communist factories for their employees. Free holidays. But nowadays nobody takes care of them anymore.

name: Dikom Petrol station with Gas
description: Here you can fill up your gas bottles/tanks. They have adapters.

name: Gas Station
description: In the back of the petrol station (little building on the right of the picture (битова газ) you can let them fill up your gas bottle. Uncomplicated.

name: Dilijan Truck stop
description:
There are showers, laundry, rooms, restaurant and parking.
A double room is 20€, overnight parking is 5€. 
The entry to the showers (and payment/check-in for everything else) is in the main building on the very left side. It says „KACA“. 
Only Bulgarian spoken, but everything you need.

name: Truck stop with laundry service & WiFi
description:
Stay over night at the parking (5€) or in the Motel (20€) and your laundry (extra charge) will be done next morning. Or have a long lunch at the attached restaurant until your laundry is ready
Dilijan Truck Stop. Entry on the far left of the building, sign says „KACA“.

name: Dilijan Motel & Overnight parking
description:
Very basic rooms but perfect for a quiet night after a long drive. Private bathroom, aircon, heating, restaurant, good and free WiFi, parking (behind the building).
20€/double room.
They have laundry service as well. 
Only Bulgarian spoken, but nice lady at the „KACA“. Check-in for rooms/Motel is on the far left of the main building next to the street.
It’s also possible to sleep in your vehicle on the parking. That’s 5€/vehicle. No additional parking fees if you rent a room. :-)

name: Vivacom / A1 shop
description:
Vivacom and A1 shops next to each other.
Vivacom reqired ID for simcard, A1 didn‘t.
A1 costs 7,50€ (15BGN) for 15Gb for 30 days.
It’s cheaper to buy a new simcard every month than to recharge it after 30 days. 
We have been using A1 for 5 months in BG now and had nearly everywhere very good network.

name: Primeks tire service
description:
Huge tire shop and workshop. They have a wide range of tires on stock. We had 4 different ones to choose from.
They mounted them right away.
Tires are not cheaper than in western Europe, but prices for work are cheap: mounting and balancing tires is 4€ per wheel.
We also let them correct the adjustment of the wheels. That was 18€.

name: Car mechanic
description:
Nick speaks perfectly English (probably better than you) and has a clean workshop. He does repairs and maintenance and will organize needed spares.
His prices are Bulgarian, so no worries!
He used to race MX, so might be a good address for motorbikes as well (we forgot to ask), but even if not, he knows where to get everything for motorbikes. :-)
It’s the workshop with the yellow gates.
His number (WhatsApp and call) is: +359 88 414 9109

name: Gas Logistics
description: A place for fill up your gas bottles. They have adapters.

name: Dry Cleaning / washing
description:
It’s upstairs, per kg or per item. 
6,50BGN per Kilogram. English spoken. No self-service.

name: Bivouac shelter "Trigradski Skali"
description: The "Trigradski skali" bivouac is located about 300 meters on the road above the Devil's Throat Cave near the village of Trigrad in the Rhodopes. The tent site is located on a small meadow in the forest, which can be reached by walking along the path to Harami Cave. On the meadow there is a shelter with tables, benches, a fireplace and a fountain with spring water, and at a distance of about 50 meters there is an outdoor toilet, which is maintained. The place is suitable for setting up a maximum of 5-6 small tents.

name: beach "Little Sea"
description: A small cove (very small), separated from the sea by rocks. At the deepest point it is up to the waist. Sometimes the bottom is sandy, sometimes it can be very rocky, depending on how the sea fills it. Ideal for children. In summer there are many caravans along and around the coast.

name: Bivouac shelter "Karierata"
description:
If you like to spend more time in nature and spend the night in the open air, the Directorate of the Vratsa Balkan National Park advises you to use the specially designated places.
8 shelters with barbecue and recreation areas have been built on the territory of Vrachanski Balkan National Park.
Camping place - CAREER area - above the village of Zgorigrad
You can reach the place:
By car or bicycle: follow the road to Ledenika Cave. The campsite is located after two turns from the fork for the village of Zgorigrad.
On foot: You start on a cognitive route "Vratsa - Ledenika Cave" starting point Vratsata Pass. After 30 minutes you will reach the quarry, where the campsite is located.

name: Camping site St. Kirik
description: St. Kirik bivouac is located near Kalofer, in the Balkan Mountains. There is a possibility for camping in a tent, as well as built fireplaces. It can also be used for a day trip. There are benches and wooden tables, a playground, a fountain, toilets, a volleyball court. Opportunity for eco and cultural tourism. The bivouac is reached by an asphalt road.

name: Bivouac shelter "Kovac"
description: Under the bridge is established camping site with benches and place for bivouac next to the river.

name: Bivouac shelter "Veleka River"
description:
There is a Bivouac shelter named after a family that donated money for building the shelter and the associated spring water turned into a tap water.
The river bed further down has caves and interesting rocks.
Please clean after yourself and keep the place tidy.

name: "Bakarlaka" peak
description:
Bakarlaka falls in the municipality of Sozopol, Ravadinovo village. It is located about 10-15 km from the town of Sozopol and can be reached by well-marked paths and asphalt road. By car you pass through the village of Rosen. It is 20 km southwest of Bourgas. One option to get there is to go to Sozopol to turn right from the Otmanli area at the Strandzha hut, and the other is through the village of Atia, which is located to the right of the Burgas Naval Base.
Bakarlaka is an attractive tourist destination because of the beautiful nature combined with the mystery of the ancient fortress and settlement. The area is especially beautiful in early spring, when lilac and linden trees begin to bloom and fill the old oak forests with a wonderful aroma, as well as when you can see the rare species of tulips, for which the protected area is declared.

name: Camping site "Devil`s Bridge"
description: It is located 10 km from the town of Ardino. It passes through the city. The road is narrow. But very well paved, without holes. And numerous turns. Normal for a mountain road. When you approach the place you can park your car and continue on foot for about 700 m. Or try to get there with your vehicle. To see the bridge up close, a fee of BGN 2 / person is paid. The Devil's Bridge is a truly amazing architectural achievement of the 5th century. It has not undergone any structural repairs since its inception. A magical place. Worth!!!

name: Camping area "Miikovci"
description:
Before the beginning of the village of Miykovtsi and along the river Borushtitsa, south of the sign of the village, there are recreation areas with benches, tables and barbecues. The places are an attractive destination for vacationers, especially during the summer months.

What attracts people are the clean cool mountain air, the song of the birds and of course - the river, where in summer you can swim. Many wild herbs grow in the area, which are clean due to the lack of pollutants and which are ideal for home use. The village of Miykovtsi is a paradise for children. It is no coincidence that children's camps, green schools and small and large attractions are made there.

name: "Miikovska" river
description: Bivouac shelter made by the municipality with fireplace and shelter with benches. Next to the river and the road.

name: "Miikovska" river
description: Bivouac with fire place next to the "Miikovska" river and the road, no shelter just a fire place and a bench.

name: "DOKUZAK" waterfall bivouac
description: Roadside, easily accessible and very beautiful waterfall! Translated from Turkish, the name Dokuzak means "nine springs" because the river on which the waterfall is located springs from nine inexhaustible karst springs in the Dokuzak Protected Area, declared in 1991.

name: PCR Test laboratory
description: This is where you get a PCR test to be able to travel further. Opening hours: 7:30-15:00 We did the test at 8:00 and got the results in the afternoon: printed out with stamp and signature in English for international border crossings. www.pisanec.com

name: House of herbs
description:
Mariela and her family rent out rooms in an old farmhouse.
All rooms are furnished with antique or 2nd hand furniture, everything is decorated with love. 
The garden is a paradise to relax in the hammock or deckchair.
